CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when a change master instance is deleted.
This event is raised when a change master instance is created.
This event is raised when a change master instance is changed.

info.description:
A change master  is an object which contains all necessary information to manage a change of various object types. The following events are available for change master: 
 - Change master changed 
 - Change master created 
 - Change master deleted
info.title: Change Master

CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when an allergen instance is created.
This event is raised when an allergen instance is deleted or flag for deletion is set.
This event is raised when an allergen instance is directly changed.

info.description:
An allergen is a substance that can trigger an allergic reaction. The following events are available for allergen: 
 - Allergen changed 
 - Allergen created 
 - Allergen deleted
info.title: Allergen

CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when a Bill of Material is changed
This event is raised when a bill of material item is changed.
This event is raised when a bill of material item is created.
This event is raised when a bill of material item is deleted.
This event is raised when a Bill of Material is created
This event is raised when a Bill of Material is deleted

info.description:
A bill of material is a list of components and their quantities that make up a top-level material. The following events are available for the bill of material: 
 - Bill of material changed 
 - Bill of material item changed 
 - Bill of material created 
 - Bill of material item created  
 - Bill of material deleted 
 - Bill of material item deleted
info.title: Bill of Material

CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when a purchase order item is blocked.
This event is raised when a purchase order instance has changed.
This event is triggered when a purchase order item is unblocked.
This event is raised when a purchase order instance has been created.
This event is triggered when a purchase order item is marked as deleted

info.description:
A purchase order is a document issued by a purchaser to a supplier indicating types, quantities, and agreed prices for products or services. The following events are available for purchase order: 
 - Purchase order changed 
 - Purchase order created 
 - Purchase order item deleted 
 - Purchase order item blocked 
 - Purchase order item unblocked
info.title: Purchase Order

CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when a customer material is deleted.
This event is raised when a customer material is created.
This event is raised when a customer material is changed.

info.description:
A customer material is a customer-specific information about a sales material. The following events are raised for customer material: 
 - Customer material changed 
 - Customer material created 
 - Customer material deleted
info.title: Customer Material

CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when an outbound delivery packing status is changed.
This event is raised when an outbound delivery is changed.
This event is raised when an outbound delivery block is changed.
This event is raised when an Outbound Delivery is deleted.
This event is raised when an outbound delivery picking status is changed.
This event is raised when an Outbound Delivery is created.

post.summary: Outbound Delivery Goods Issue Status Changed
post.description: This event is raised when an outbound delivery goods issue status is changed.

info.description:
An outbound delivery is a document representing the goods to be delivered together to a goods recipient. The following events are available for outbound delivery: 
 - Outbound delivery created 
 - Outbound delivery changed 
 - Outbound delivery deleted 
 - Outbound delivery block changed 
 - Outbound delivery goods issue status changed 
 - Outbound delivery picking status changed 
 - Outbound delivery packing status changed
info.title: Outbound Delivery

CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.
CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

post.description: This event is raised when a sales order instance has been deleted.
This event is raised when a sales order instance has changed.
This event is raised when a sales order instance has been created.

info.description:
A sales order is a customer request to the company for delivery of goods or services at a certain time. The following events are available for sales order: 
 - Sales order changed 
 - Sales order created 
 - Sales order deleted
info.title: Sales Order

OutboundDeliveryGoodsIssueStatusChanged.description:
Informs a remote system about created, changed, and deleted outbound deliveries in an SAP S/4HANA system.

This is an in-built native S/4Hana notification event as described on the API business Hub, here:
https://api.sap.com/event/SAPS4HANABusinessEvents_OutboundDeliveryEvents/overview

ChangeMasterCreated.description:
This event is raised when a change master instance is created.

This is an in-built native S/4Hana notification event as described on the API business Hub, here:
https://api.sap.com/event/SAPS4HANABusinessEvents_ChangeMasterEvents/overview

AsapioOrderCreated.description: This is an example of a full event generated by the Asapio Add-on (also available as Event Enablement Add-on).
